channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Microsoft's AI Dreams Make for an Expensive Reality
item.description: Blowout capital spending as the company’s cloud growth disappoints won’t hearten investors.

item.title: This strategist is predicting a big rally after the Fed decision. He’s been more right than wrong this year.
item.description: Thomas Lee, the usually optimistic co-founder and head of research at Fundstrat Global Advisor, is expecting a small-cap-led rally.

item.title: HSBC Quarterly Profit Drops, Plans $3 Billion Buyback
item.description: The London-based bank said net profit declined 3.6% from a year earlier but it still beat consensus estimates.

item.title: A surprise Fed rate cut might be good for consumers — but not for the stock market
item.description: Investors are clamoring for affirmation the Fed will begin cutting rates in September. But a surprise easing on Wednesday likely wouldn’t go over well.

item.title: Big Tech Stocks Keep Falling Ahead of Earnings Deluge, Fed Meeting
item.description: Meta Platforms, Amazon and Apple will report in the coming days.

item.title: Microsoft and AMD earnings show that AI remains a game of optics
item.description: The dichotomy in Wall Street’s reactions to the results from Microsoft Corp. and Advanced Micro Devices Inc. — two tech giants that have been investing heavily in AI — is a perfect example of the AI optics game.

item.title: How We Are Trying to Increase the Odds of Having a Healthy Retirement
item.description: Deterioration in our bodies is inevitable. But there are things we’re doing that, we hope, will keep us healthier longer.

item.title: Apple earnings will be all about this one clue
item.description: Apple’s June-quarter earnings report isn’t typically one to write home about, but there’s still value to it.

item.title: Gas or Electric? Splitting the Difference Could Energize Chinese Automakers
item.description: Range anxiety is bad for battery demand but good news for Chinese PHEV makers.

item.title: Intel earnings: Can the company cut its way to an improved position?
item.description: Intel is expected to post a decline in adjusted profit when it reports earnings Thursday, and job cuts reportedly are on the horizon.
